subject: RE: [junit] checking for test coverage
msgSnippet: Hi, Here s one I had considered using. http://jester.sourceforge.net/ However we are retro fitting unit tests to our source, and a quick ratio of unit tests to
messageBody:
Hi,

Here's one I had considered using.

http://jester.sourceforge.net/


However we are retro fitting unit tests to our source, and a quick ratio
of unit tests to classes tells me I've to increase the number of units
tests before I run coverage tools.


Brendan.


-----Original Message-----
From: Vladimir Bossicard [mailto:vladimir@...]
Sent: Tuesday, February 05, 2002 5:33 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] checking for test coverage


> Does anyone know of any utilities that can check for test coverage.


You can have a look at Quilt: http://quilt.sourceforge.net

Off the record: it would be interesting to know what is the average
coverage of the Test First Design method: 80%, 90%, 95%, 100%?

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir Bossicard
